009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
017import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
018import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
019import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
020import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
021import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
022
023import java.util.Random;
024
025import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
026
027/**
028 * <p> ImageJ plugin -
029 * implementation of the "Jitter filter" based on {@link GenericFilter}. Works for all image types, using
030 * nearest-border-pixel strategy. The input image is destructively modified.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * Note that only the operation for a single pixel needs to be specified (method {@code GenericFilterVector.doPixel()}
034 * in the inner class {@code JitterFilter}), everything else (i.e., looping over all pixels, special treatment of border
035 * pixels and multiple color components) are automatically handled by {@link GenericFilter}. See Sec. 4.7 (Exercise
036 * 4.14) of [1] for additional details.
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
040 * (2022).
041 * </p>
042 *
043 * @author WB
044 * @version 2022/09/23
045 *
046 * @see GenericFilter
047 * @see OutOfBoundsStrategy
048 */
049public class Jitter_Filter_GenericFilter implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
050        
051        /** The filter radius. */
052        public static int R = 3;
053        /** The out-of-bounds strategy to be used (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
054        public static OutOfBoundsStrategy OBS = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
055
056        /** Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open. */
057        public Jitter_Filter_GenericFilter() {
058                if (noCurrentImage()) {
059                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower);
060                }
061        }
062                
063        @Override
064        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
065                return DOES_ALL;
066        }
067
068        @Override
069        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
070                if (!runDialog()) {
071                        return;
072                }
073
074                GenericFilter filter = new JitterFilter();      // see below
075                filter.applyTo(ip, OBS);        // that's all!
076        }
077        
078        // --------------------------------------------------------------
079
080        /**
081         * This inner class actually implements the Jitter filter, based on the functionality provided by
082         * {@link GenericFilterVector}, which can process images with 1 or more color channels. All we need to do is to
083         * specify what is to be done for a single pixel.
084         */
085        private static class JitterFilter extends GenericFilterVector {
086                private final int dist = 2 * R + 1;     // width/height of the "kernel"
087                private final Random rnd = new Random();
088                
089                @Override
090                protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
091                        int rx = rnd.nextInt(dist) - R;
092                        int ry = rnd.nextInt(dist) - R;
093                        return source.getPix(u + rx, v + ry);
094                }
095        }
096
097        private boolean runDialog() {
098                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
099                gd.addHelp(getJavaDocUrl());
100                gd.addMessage("Filter kernel size is (2r+1) x (2r+1):");
101                gd.addNumericField("Kernel radius (r > 0)", R, 0);
102                gd.addEnumChoice("Out-of-bounds strategy", OBS);
103
104                gd.showDialog();
105                if (gd.wasCanceled())
106                        return false;
107
108                R = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
109                OBS = gd.getNextEnumChoice(OutOfBoundsStrategy.class);
110                return true;
111        }
112}
